meanings.definition: The act of making something capable of holding more.
meanings.sent1: The capacitations of the jar allowed it to store extra cookies.
meanings.sent2: The capacitations of the backpack were tested by adding more books.
meanings.sent3: The capacitations of the cup surprised everyone when it held more than expected.
meanings.sent4: Her brain's capacitations expanded like a balloon filling with air.
meanings.sent5: The capacitations of the sponge made it soak up water quickly.

meanings.definition: The process of increasing the ability or power of something.
meanings.sent1: Regular exercise can lead to the capacitations of the muscles.
meanings.sent2: The training program focused on the capacitations of the athletes.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand had the capacitations to make things disappear.
meanings.sent4: Education acts as a key to unlock the capacitations of the mind.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape symbolized the capacitations of his strength.

meanings.definition: The state of being able to receive or contain something.
meanings.sent1: The box's capacitations were tested by fitting in more toys.
meanings.sent2: The jar's capacitations were evident when it held all the marbles.
meanings.sent3: The balloon's capacitations were challenged when too much air was blown in.
meanings.sent4: Her heart's capacitations for love knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The bucket's capacitations for water were impressive during the storm.
